result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah R Dachs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeremiah R Dachs is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeremiah R Dachs was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and treatment

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $600.00 plus applicable costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA) during the term of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. If revoked; Court ordered that all court costs, fines, fees and surcharges be paid through collection by the Dept. of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

- AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges for work, AODA treatment, and medical treatment, after serving the first 30 days STRAIGHT TIME. No Good Time Credit allowed.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremiah R Dachs

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jeremiah R Dachs in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Jeremiah R Dachs.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for sentencing.  Statements by the State, Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 5 DAYS time served and Huber privileges for work and treatment.   The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION IF REVOKED:
- 60 DAYS of condition time at the House of Correction with Huber privileges, for work, AODA treatment, and medical treatment, after serving the first 30 days STRAIGHT TIME.  No good time credit allowed. 
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Operating privileges revoked for a period of 2 YEARS. 
- Ignition interlock for a period of 1 YEAR.
- AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests. 
- Full-time employment. 

The Court ordered the defendant to pay a fine of $600 plus applicable costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) during the term of probation. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. If revoked, Court ordered that all court costs, fines, fees, and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

20 day appeal rights given. Firearm and voting warnings given.

Defendant Jeremiah R Dachs in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Jeremiah R Dachs.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for jury trial.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.

AS TO COUNT 2:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 DISMISSED by operation of law.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Due to the lateness of the hour, Court adjourned sentencing hearing to tomorrow morning.  Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for sentencing. Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed: Jury Instructions
Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum
Received and Filed:  State's Offer Letter

Defendant Jeremiah R Dachs in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Jeremiah R Dachs.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for jury trial.  State is not ready to proceed today due to witness availability.  Court passed matter to 1:30 following the jury trial in case #21CF801.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Motion to Adjourn Trial.

Defendant Jeremiah R Dachs in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Jeremiah R Dachs.  Attorney Samuel Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial.  Parties are still in negotiations.  Jury trial remains scheduled for October 10, 2022.  Court will hear a change of plea at 8:30 am on the morning of trial.  Defense instructed to file plea documents ahead of time.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Motion in Limine.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed:  State's Motion in Limine.
Received and Filed:  State's Motion to Admit 911
Received and Filed.

Defendant Jeremiah R Dachs in court with Attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for calendar call.  Court withdrew stayed warrant.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 9-01-2022 and all responses to be filed by 9-28-2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but STAYED the issuance until the next court date.  Court scheduled a calendar call hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Calendar call scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in Court for a scheduling conference.  Court is in trial and rescheduled the matter.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed.

Waiver of preliminary hearing proceeded.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters pleas of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.
Signed and Filed:  Order Appointing Counsel at County Expense.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license and insurance.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jeremiah R Dachs in court with Attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.  Attorney Matthew Plummer was appointed by the Court to represent the defendant in his lower pending matter.  Defendant requests court appointed counsel at the county rate in this matter. Court appoints Attorney Matthew Plummer who shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour. Court orders defendant to repay the County at a rate of $50.00/month beginning upon completion of the case and every month thereafter until paid in full.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
